hotspots.label: Fossilized Shells
hotspots.fact: The lizard exhibits a high degree of camouflage; its skin texture and dark brown/grey mottled pattern mimic the shadows and organic debris, such as the dried leaves, found among the rocks.

hotspots.label: Weathered Pebbles
hotspots.fact: These smooth, rounded rocks have been shaped by water and waves for many years. The constant movement of water wears down sharp edges and makes them nice and smooth.

hotspots.label: Mixed Rock Sizes
hotspots.fact: You can see rocks of many different sizes in one place! Larger rocks stay closer to shore while smaller pebbles and sand get carried farther by waves and currents.

hotspots.label: Rock Color Variation
hotspots.fact: These rocks have different colors because they come from different types of stone and minerals. The browns, tans, and grays tell us about Earth's diverse geology!
